item.title: Create a Repo to Track Your Computer's Settings
item.author: 作者
item.description: As a beginner, I manually add several dotfiles to the Repo like this. # Create a Repo git clone git@github.com:<username>/dotfiles.git cd dotfiles mv ~/.vimrc . git add .vimrc git commit -m "your message" # Symbolically linking files ln -s /path/to/dotfiles/.vimrc ~/.vimrc # push to remote git push origin master References: Some tutorials : Guide to dotfiles on Github

item.title: Version Control with Git
item.author: 作者
item.description:
Study note of the Course: Udacity Course: Version Control with Git

What is version Control

Example: Control -Z

Types of Version Control: Centralized and Distributed(e.g. Git)

Terminology: SCM(Source Control Manager)/VCS(Version Control System)

Git Setup and Config

# sets up Git with your name
git config --global user.name "<Your-Full-Name>"
# sets up Git with your email
git config --global user.email "<your-email-address>"
# makes sure that Git output is colored
git config --global color.ui auto
# displays the original state in a conflict
git config --global merge.conflictstyle diff3
git config --list
git config --global core.editor "mvim -f"

item.title: Python RegEx Basics
item.author: 作者
item.description:
引入正则表达式模块

import re

一般字符

.: 除换行符(\n)外的任意字符

\: 转义字符

如: \\, \.

如: [au], [a-z], [A-Z], [0-9], [0-9a-z], [^ac](非ac)

re.search(r"r[A-Z]n", “run”)

item.title: Basic Linux Commands
item.author: 作者
item.description:
1. du – display disk usage statistics

du -d 1 -h Documents # -d:depth -h:"human-readable"
du -d 0 -h Documents

2. grep – file pattern searcher

grep stands for “global regular expression print”. It searches files for lines that match a pattern and returns the results. It is case sensitive.

grep "Apple" fruit.txt
grep -i "Apple" fruit.txt #-i:case insensitive
grep -R "Apple" ~/Documents/fruit # -R: recursive

item.title: Markdown Basics
item.author: 作者
item.description:
Headers

h4

h5
